Fields.DialogueText: Ah, Captain, there you are! How goes the Morgana watch?
Calm seas at present, Vendetta.
I only ask since you look a little knackered. If they come soon, will you be ready to die?
To… to die?
Yes! If the Morganas come in the next 24 hours, will you be ready to die!?
What an introspective question. My time as a Captain has been filled with mishaps but I never once pondered whether I was ready to die or not.
You've lost me, Captain. I, for one, am positively ready to die!
You are!?
Of course! I'm ready to die, tomorrow, or the day after that!
Oh! "Today!"
*GLARE*

Fields.MenuText: Vendetta… your eyes have gone red.
The Australian accent is a trifle difficult for those not in the know, huh?
You lost your English accent pretty quickly, didn't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Under the circumstances, I think you can understand why…
Sorry, we can't all speak like His Majesty the King, Captain! "La, di, da, would you like to visit the National Gallery TOO-DAI?!"
Too quickly, it looks like.
*ALARM*
Vendetta, are you ready… to… your eyes have turned scarlet again.
Let's just say that, had this teasing continued, someone was about to be put into a headlock. For your sake, Captain, it looks like these Morganas arrived just in time.
*Gulp* Well then, what are we waiting for?
Morganas! Are you ready to die!?
@BATTLE
Vendetta! I've been thinking about your question from earlier.
You'll have to refresh my memory, Captain.
Remember? When you asked me if I was ready to die?
Captain, please! I try enough as it is to talk all proper like you and the crew. I don't need it pointed out!
Regardless. It got me thinking. Do Belles ever fear death? Going into battle every day must take a toll on the psyche.
I can only speak for myself, but... if it happens, it happens!

Fields.MenuText: Cold-blooded...
Any reason for your laissez-faire attitude?

Fields.DialogueText: As my namesake would suggest, revenge is a dish best served cold. I'm not all doom and gloom though, Captain. Revenge can also be sweet. Really, what I'm trying to say is... I'm like ice cream.
Deliciously pleasant, but with a nasty brain-freeze kick!
Having been shipped off from my homeland to Australia did take a toll on me. Moreover, we Belles are not designed to be indispensible.
Especially destroyers... DOUBLY especially for aging ships like me. I've grown to love Australia, but I'm not sure the feeling is mutual.

Fields.MenuText: In some cultures, it's considered an honor to die in battle.

Fields.DialogueText: Honor, schmonor! Only nobles fight for such things. I fight for the thrill of it!
*ALARM*
Don't go dying on me yet! We still have business to do!
HA! Who do you think you're talking to!? I'll give you a crash course in why even the reaper is too scared to come for me! Make sure to stay out of my way if you don't wanna get hurt!
@BATTLE
Phew! You really know your way around those Morganas!
It takes one to know one.
... Should I sound the alarm now or...?
HA! No need. I'm simply stating that we think alike.
You and the demon ghost ships that seek to destroy the world. Hm, yes... I think I will sound the alarm, on second thought.
We're both built for destruction! I don't know if Morganas feel emotion. They certainly scream when I blow them up! I don't care for them, but it helps to empathise when tracking their movements.

Fields.MenuText: They say it takes a monster to kill a monster.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe you don’t need a monster to fight monsters – I couldn’t say.  But since you do happen to have one handy, Captain, you might as well make the most of her!

Fields.MenuText: Morganas scream? I never noticed.

Fields.DialogueText: Do they ever! There was one particular Morgana a few days ago. Strewth, the set of pipes on her! I remember the elation I felt staring into her eyes as she... *ahem* I've gotten carried away again.

Fields.MenuText: What kind of things can you predict through this method?

Fields.DialogueText: Pathing routes, mostly. If I think of the quickest, most efficient way to sink a destroyer such as myself, I can easily catch them mid-flank!
*ALARM*
Vendetta? Is your Morgana sense tingling?
I can smell blood on the water, Captain. It's getting me all excited just thinking about it!
Really? By that toothy grin you're sporting, I thought otherwise...
Quickly, Captain! Let's show them who they're messing with!
Ow! Vendetta, my arm! You're going to yank it out of the socket!
@BATTLE
Captain! How's the arm?
Well, I can lift a mug and throw a punch. No serious harm done.
HA! Good to hear! You'd be surprised at just how many officials would have me suspended for such an abrasive act.
You're joking. Surely a tight grip should be the minimum requirement of passing the destroyer entrance exam.
HA! Nicely put, Captain. I think so too. These fuddy-duddy authority figures seem to dislike my... rashness.

Fields.MenuText: What kinds of things do they say?

Fields.DialogueText: I know that, compared to other Belles, I'm not the safe kind of feminine. Still, I'd rather hear that to my face than behind my back. At least that way I could give them a good clocking for it.

Fields.MenuText: Have you always been so bloodthirsty?

Fields.DialogueText: When I was younger, I likened myself to a cat playing with mice. Now, I'm like a cat playing with dogs. All the fun of teasing, but with an extra layer of danger coated on top!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we could have an arm wrestle some time and you can train my grip.

Fields.DialogueText: HA! You look mighty strong yourself, Captain, but I'd be up for the challenge!
Try to forget about those past experiences, Vendetta. Aboard my ship, no one will talk to you that way.
Too right! Unless they're in need of a knuckle--
No. Because I won't allow it, that's why.
Oh... well... thank you, Captain. That, uh... means a lot.
Vendetta? Everything all right?
H-HA! No problems on my end! I feel a second wind approaching! All I need now is--
*ALARM*
Perfect timing! Permission to let loose, Captain?
Permission granted on one condition.
Hit me.
You never ask for permission again!
That's a dangerous game you're playing, Captain! Give me free rein to go wild, and you'd better hang on!
@BATTLE
Captain! Look what I managed to swipe from that last flotilla of Morganas we just destroyed!
What on earth is that?
I'm not quite sure myself. I think it's a piece of a hull!
Good lord, you really did a number on them.
Damn straight! It was such a good fight, I decided to add a shard of it to my collection. Check it out!
A necklace? What's this... a ring... a gold piece... is that someone's tooth!?
Oh, yeah. That's from Jenkins down in the mess hall. That will teach him not to short-change me on roast potato night!

Fields.MenuText: Doesn't putting so many trinkets on one necklace weigh you down?

Fields.DialogueText: On the contrary. It's great for endurance training!

Fields.MenuText: What trophy would you take from me if I was defeated in battle?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm. You have a great smile - looks pretty valuable... Although, to obtain that would take a great deal of precision and some excellent knife proficiency. Maybe I'll just take the captain hat instead.

Fields.MenuText: Do you have a favourite trophy?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe this pearl I swiped during one of my first missions. I took it, looked my opponent dead in the eyes, then sank her! She'll be off to Davy Jones drowning in thoughts of me! Just how I like it!
There we go. This shrapnel fits nice and snug between the dog collar and the hair ribbon.
Just how many enemies do you have...?
*ALARM*
Ooh! More trophies await! Morganas, tally-ho!
@BATTLE
Captain! What do you think? Too flashy?
No, I think it looks great! I didn't think you'd be into this kind of look.
What exactly did you have in mind?
I don't know maybe some kind of...
I'm still a woman, Captain. I enjoy looking glamorous as much as the rest of them. Although rest assured, I've chosen an outfit that allows for maximum leg mobility.
Of course, of course. Hey, speaking of new outfits, didn't I see a pair of stilettos in your room once? You're not wearing them now.
HA! Captain, those have an entirely different purpose.
HOO-HA!
*OOF*
What do you think?
You use the stilettos... for target practice!?
I couldn't hold a flimsy arrow or dart in my hands! I'd crush them! Stilettos make for excellent ammo! YA!
*BOOF*

Fields.MenuText: So you never wear these?

Fields.DialogueText: When I'm bored I spin them on my finger, I suppose. Or clean out the underside of my nails with the heel.

Fields.MenuText: Has that bullseye always been in the bridge?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know what you're talking about, Captain. That's been there for as long as I can remember! HWAH!

Fields.MenuText: What's next? Combat boots?

Fields.DialogueText: HA! That's not a bad idea!
*ALARM*
Morganas! I never thought I'd say this, but Vendetta... grab as many shoes as you can and meet me on the deck!
Aye-aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
(Bloodstained battle armor?)
... Shirt?
Vendetta? Mind if I join you? You look as though you're in need of an opponent.
Do you play chess, Captain?
I feel as though you stole my line there, Vendetta...
HA! A sharp mind is the first step to a sharp body! Come! Entertain me!
*ALARM*
A little warm-up sounds good before the real showdown! Let's dispatch these Morganas quickly!
@BATTLE
Hm...
Make your move, Captain. My troops are getting restless!
What if I...?
I wouldn't do that, Captain.
Why not?
If you move your rook there, then I'm going to move my bishop here. That will force you to take me, but will leave your queen entirely exposed. Then, some twenty turns later, It'll be checkmate.
What if I--?
Ah!
How about--?
Ooh!
Then I must have to--?
Eek!
Damn it, what move CAN I make then!?
HA! Truth be told, Captain, I don't see a happy ending for you in this game. You lost the second you moved your knight on turn one!

Fields.MenuText: How did you get so good at chess?

Fields.DialogueText: Chess, like war, is a game of patience and planning. I may be similar to the Morgana of Wrath in that I love destruction. But if you don't plan your attack thoroughly, you'll never get to execute it!

Fields.MenuText: Why did you sacrifice so many pieces early on?

Fields.DialogueText: You have to spend money to make money, Captain. A sacrifice here and there is par for the course in wartime.
Rest assured, I'll be sure to attain something of incredible value in exchange for your life if it's ever on the chopping block!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we could try checkers instead...

Fields.DialogueText: Chess, Checkers, Monopoly, Rock-Paper-Scissors - I'll take you on in any game you choose!
Very well, I concede. You're an incredible tactician, Vendetta!
Oh... th-thank you, Captain.
As much as of a powerhouse as you are, people don't give your mind enough credit. You're much more than just a brute killing things blindly.
I... I um... that means a lot to hear you say and... Is that the Morgana alarm!? For some reason, I really need to kill something! Now!
That's a lot of notebooks you have, Vendetta. I hope this isn't some elaborate list of those who wronged you and will be met with revenge.
HA! You aren't entirely wrong, Captain, but it's much tamer than that.
What are they for?
These black books are all biographies for each individual member aboard this ship. Likes, dislikes, pet peeves, etcetera. *These* black books detail the same information for my fellow Belles.
Whatever for?
Several reasons. I enjoy hearing the stories of those by my side, for one. I'm fascinated by the uniqueness of the human condition as well.
Vendetta...
... And if any of them ever wronged me, I could hit them personally where it really hurts...
Also, if anything happens to someone, I can make amends with their loved ones through the address glossary.

Fields.MenuText: I know you're worried about being abandoned, but you shouldn't be.

Fields.DialogueText: Australia could cast me aside any day. I just want to be prepared for when they do...

Fields.MenuText: Do you really mistrust the crew so much?

Fields.DialogueText: Not at all! I just need to seek revenge on those who tease me too often. Being referred to as the "prettiest preying mantis" anyone has ever seen hurts more than you think.

Fields.MenuText: You have no qualms turning on people you were once so close with?

Fields.DialogueText: As they say, Captain: you don't need to be faster than the bear. You just need to be faster than the guy next to you.
Who's this white book for?
DON'T TOUCH THAT!
I... I'm sorry...
*Ahem* Sorry about that, Captain. That one is... that's for someone special. You can't read that one. But here, this one is about Jenkins. Did you know he's still afraid of the dark?
*ALARM*
Morganas! Come, Captain, no time to focus on my books! We have a mission to do!
@BATTLE
We shouldn't be docked for too long. A quick resupply and we'll be back on the waters before lunch.
What's the rush, Captain? We rarely get to stretch our legs like this. This fresh, crisp air. It reminds me of home!

Fields.MenuText: Which home? England or Australia?

Fields.DialogueText: Even if they cast me out, England will forever be my home and I will always fight to defend it. Still, I think I'd prefer to live in Australia, all things considered. England never stops raining!

Fields.MenuText: How do you feel about England?
What do you think of Australia?

Fields.DialogueText: It's strange. The food is bland, the weather's terrible, and the skies are grey, but I can't help but smile when I talk about it.
It took me a while to get used to the heat, but now I couldn't live without it! The bugs, however, I could do without. Some of those spiders even I would be scared to fight against!
What about your family? Do you miss them?
My family, huh?
*ALARM*
I tell you what, Captain. As a reward for helping me take down these Morganas, I'll let you in on a little secret.
@BATTLE
Is this secret you have to tell me so monumental it requires suffocating down here?
Sorry, Captain, but this is my Achilles' heel.
I can't imagine you having such a weakness, Vendetta.
The truth is...
Yes?
I do have family. Sisters, in fact. And lots of them! I care for them VERY deeply!
Uh-huh...?
Don'y you understand, Captain? They are a weakness, an exploitable chink in my armor! No one must ever know that I am capable of such things!
What things? Having sisters?
Love!

Fields.MenuText: Do you worry about any sister in particular?
Which sister are you closest with?
The crew and other Belles are replaceable, but your sisters aren't?

Fields.DialogueText: Probably Vivien. As an escort and patrol ship, she's seen very little action on the front lines. I worry that she wouldn't be ready if things kicked off.

It has to be Vimiera. I learnt most of what I know from her, so naturally we're pretty similar. Matter of fact, we both have the same scratch on the underside of our hull from a mission way back when!
Blood runs thicker than seawater, Captain.
Well, whatever kind of secret it is, it's safe with me.
I appreciate it, Captain. And... if you ever feel the desire to confess your deepest, darkest secrets to someone, feel free to ring my alarm.
*ALARM*
So soon, Captain? What could it be? A secret gambling addiction? Cheating on me with another Belle? It's Vampire, isn't it!? I knew she couldn't be trusted!
How is it that, while being slowly surrounded by a fleet of monstrous apparitions, you're still the scariest thing in the vicinity?
HA! I'll take that as a compliment. Now, come on, Captain! We have work to do!
@BATTLE
Captain. Am I interrupting?
Not at all. How can I help?
I was wondering if you had a pen I could borrow. I seem to have exhausted the ship's supply filling out all these notebooks.
I should be able to help you out. Come in.
I appreciate it. It's been really tough keeping all this information up to date.
*CREAAAAAAK*
What was that!?
We must have hit something. Status report!
Apologies, Captain. Jenkins dozed off on lookout duty and didn't notice a large trench ahead. It should be smooth sailing from here.
That's a relief. Sorry about bumping into you, Captain, I didn't mean to knock you down to the...
Vendetta... it was an accident! The white notebook must have slipped out during our collision! It opened by itself, I swear!
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: I don't know if those glowing red eyes are for me or the Morganas...
I don't know if that toothy grin is one of happiness or madness...
I don't know if I'm safer here or on the Morgana ship...

Fields.DialogueText: We'll talk about this after I'm through unleashing utter carnage.
@BATTLE
*BUMP*
Captain! What in the name of His Majesty the King do you think you're doing?
Keep talking and you'll find out.
Better the monster you know, isn't it?
Take your pick, Captain, and mind you choose carefully.
Er...
The white notebook... is for me?
Why couldn't you just tell me that?
... It's embarrassing.
Blow me down, I never thought I'd see the day. Vendetta, stunned into silent submission!
All right, all right, you've had your fun. Now, give it back!
I'm not allowed to read it?
Of course not! This is my private, personal business!
But you tell me about all the crazy stuff Jenkins gets up to all the time! Only last week you were telling me about how he got stuck in the rudders. Well, a part of him anyway. Poor guy.
That's different! Telling someone about it is less intimate than having you read my handwriting directly.
Well, then you'll just have to read it to me, won't you?
What!?
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: No time to waste!
Let's get this over and done with!
Hurry! I'm dying of anticipation.

Fields.DialogueText: I knew I should have kept my mouth shut...
@BATTLE
Right, Captain. This battle.
In-indeed!
You'll be dying of something loads worse if you don't get moving!
Come now, I haven't got all day.
Very well... What would you like to hear about?

Fields.MenuText: Likes and dislikes.
Pet peeves.
Fun fact.

Fields.DialogueText: "The Captain likes all things naval, particularly enjoying walking the deck and becoming irritated when forced off it."
"The Captain finds it very inconvenient to be taken down and placed into a headlock. Source: personal experience."
"The Captain often does nightly rounds to ensure the crew are sleeping soundly. A well-rested crew is a happy crew and it won't do for them to doze off. "
"Edit: Jenkins is the exception."
Pretty spot on, if I do say so myself.
Thanks.
Not very personal, though.
I was just about to get to that part...
Then please, read away!
*ALARM*
Blasted Morganas!
Saved by the bell...
You're not getting away that easily. After we take out these monsters, it's straight back to business.
Aye-aye, Captain...
@BATTLE
Okay, now where were we?
Right. "Captain. Entry Log. Bio: The Captain is a strong and confident leader, always prepared for battle and a source of pride for Belle and crew."
Very nice. Thanks a lot, Vendetta, that was really--
"Oftentimes, crews fall for the Belle aboard their ship, but that seems to have passed me by. I get along with the crew but I know some of them remain fearful of me."
Uh... Vendetta...?
"The Captain always makes me feel wanted. Even after London themselves kicked me to the proverbial curb, I found a sense of belonging with my new choice."
Vendetta...
"Truly a saint among sailors. No one is more deserving of this angelic white notebook."
Well... that was--
"P.S. Anecdotally, saints are pretty good arm wrestlers."
I don't know what to say.
I think I'd rather you didn't say anything, to be honest. I could die of embarrassment!

Fields.MenuText: It means a lot to hear that.

Fields.DialogueText: I meant every word, so don't think I'm a liar!

Fields.MenuText: I never knew you were so soppy!

Fields.DialogueText: I will sink this ship along with everyone on it if you tell anyone.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't thank me. I didn't do it as a favor.
*ALARM*
Morganas. Vendetta, would you care to join me?
It can't be helped. Under "Captain's fighting skill" I unfortunately had to write "Relies on Vendetta too much!"
@BATTLE
Vendetta! How are you? I feel as though we've barely spoken since our meeting in my office.
(Vendetta tried her best and really opened up to me at that time. She must feel incredibly awkward after being so vulnerable. I should make a little effort to initiate a conversation.)
HA! Captain, take a seat and join me for dinner!
(Or not...)
I tell you what: most Belles would turn their noses up at such a feast, but I'm already thinking about seconds!
Are you close with other Belles?
HA! Define "close".

Fields.MenuText: Do you have a favorite type of Belle?
Do any Belles irritate you?

Fields.DialogueText: Purely superficially, but I've always loved the Italian Belle style! I am a bona fide fashionista myself, as you can plainly see, so we can relate to each other!
Vice versa, Captain! German Belles can barely keep their tops on when I proclaim how "Mack the Knife" is the greatest anthem their country ever produced!

Fields.MenuText: Do you have any good Belle friends?

Fields.DialogueText: More so acquaintances. Friends invite the possibility of betrayal. I prefer to keep everyone at arm's length to avoid being deceived.
I guess you don't make new bonds so easily, huh? It means a lot that you find me amicable.
HA! Don't think yourself so special, Captain! Maybe I'm just keeping you nearby as a way to further my own interests!
Well, if that were true, you do an excellent job of hiding it.
You sweet talker, you.
*ALARM*
Morganas!
Let me remind you why I'm a dangerous person to keep around!
@BATTLE
You know, as long as we've been together, I've learned virtually nothing of your past.
HA! That's by design, Captain.
How did you come to find yourself in Australia? I know of the order that sent you there, but I want the unabridged Vendetta version.
Well, you know a bit about my role during the Great War. The 13th Destroyer Flotilla and all that. I made a lot of enemies during that time that I'm itching to meet on the other side.
My mind recollects three major battles that still give me tingles!
Can you tell me about them? I'd like to hear about battle number...

Fields.MenuText: One.
Two.
Three.

Fields.DialogueText: In 1917, I remember firing on some German ships in the Kattegat. Let's just say that I was ready for them, but they weren't ready for me!
After the HMS Cassandra hit a mine and sank, I rescued 430 total passengers and took them to safety. See, Captain? My war stories aren't all blood and gore!
In 1918, I was assigned to operate against Bolshevik forces in the Baltic. My mission was running the destroyer Spartak aground and assisting in the capture of the destroyer Lennuk.
That one was pretty tough, but I managed to survive it somehow.
That's incredible! So then, what about Australia?
*ALARM*
I'll conclude my autobiography after this battle. I can show you my legacy much better than I can tell you anyway!
@BATTLE
So, you were telling me about your move to Australia.
Right! You say "move," but it was more akin to being placed onto the substitute bench. I'd already had my time in the light, or so I thought.
What did you do during the break between wars?
I went about my usual peacetime duties. You know, making the usual rounds. Then I was recommissioned for the war effort and put to work in the Mediterranean!
And how has it been so far?
HA! I'm still breathing, aren't I!?
*ALARM*
I'll tell you what's about to take its final breath, though! With me!
@BATTLE
And that pretty much covers most of the major events in my life before being placed under your command. Any questions? This will all be on the final, you know!

Fields.MenuText: Were you happy to be placed in the field again?
Any Australian you can teach me?
Was it tough?

Fields.DialogueText: Uhh... wow... No one has ever asked THAT before? Yeah, actually, it was. It was REALLY tough, in fact!
Overjoyed! You know I'm not one for peacetime, Captain!
Hm. "Arvo" means afternoon. "Dunny" means restroom. Oh! The word for "sandals" is pretty amusing - but, as a lady, I can't repeat it in polite conversation!
You've lived a hell of a life, huh?
What do you mean, "lived!?" I'm not done living it yet!
Haha! Of course you aren't!
I hope you'll see it through with me to the bitter end.
How could I not?
Captain! Pull up a seat and join me!
Evening, Vendetta. How goes--
GRAHHHHHH!
... What was that, Jenkins? Yes, I'll be right there!
Sorry, Captain, I didn't mean to startle you. I'm trying to get this straw into my carton of milk, but it just won't pierce through!
If this is how irate you become at a carton of milk, I feel somewhat bad for the Morganas...
WHO ARE THEY TRYING TO KEEP OUT OF THESE MILK CARTONS!? THE SIS!?

Fields.MenuText: Do your eyes always go red when you're angry?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a trait shared by a few of my sisters. Whenever our blood boils, it starts to overflow into our eyes!

Fields.MenuText: You're not donning your signature smile?

Fields.DialogueText: HA! I only bare my fangs out of joy! I love a good battle, but this milk carton is proving to be an irritating adversary! A good fight is only fun if both sides are equally matched.

Fields.MenuText: Don't you just push the straw through?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain... I'd tread very carefully if I were you. I may have to stick this straw somewhere else if you continue to tease me.
Maybe we could work on your anger issues. I've picked up some tips for keeping calm under pressure.
Are you saying my anger is a problem!?
No, no, no! Just that we should get it under control before your blood pressure spikes.
Hm. You have a good point. I can't have my legacy end with a sudden heart attack! I need to go out in a blaze of glory!
*ALARM*
We don't have to start the anger management right away, do we, Captain?
Get it all out of your system now.
Aye-aye!
@BATTLE
Okay, Vendetta. Before we begin, I think we need to discern what exactly grinds your gears.
Do you have any plans for the rest of the day?
Seriously. What makes you angry?
Hm. Morganas... Lateness... Whatever that thing Jenkins is always doing. He told me once he was fishing for a mermaid to--
Okay, okay, I think I get the picture.
It's hopeless, right?
Far from it. First, I want you to do me a favor.
What is it?
I want you to picture something that really gets your blood boiling!
I'm not sure... do you have any recommendations?

Fields.MenuText: Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Just thinking of the torment they've caused not only me, but those I care about... Ooh, it's enough to make me explode!

Fields.MenuText: Your biggest fear.

Fields.DialogueText: Probably being betrayed. London already cast me aside once. I'll never forget that feeling!

Fields.MenuText: Jenkins.

Fields.DialogueText: JEEEEENKIIIIIIINS!
Great, you're nice and riled up!
I don't know if I can hold out much longer, Captain! I'm about to burst!
*ALARM*
I may have overdone it with the provocation... How about you take this 99% anger and bring it down to a 50% by whaling on these Morganas?
With pleasure!
@BATTLE
How are you feeling now, Vendetta?
Lightly toasted with no fear of burning.
Excellent! What I want you to try is this. Whenever you're feeling angry, count backwards from ten.
That's it?
And as you do, with each number that passes, I want you to picture something that makes you happy.
What exactly do you hope to accomplish in doing this?

Fields.MenuText: The happy thoughts will quell your rage.
Taking a ten-second breather will relieve some of the pressure.
Do you have any better ideas?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Very well. Let's begin.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's deal with them quickly and get right back to business!
@BATTLE
That's a short period for a long history of violence, Captain.
But what if working out my rage is the happy thought?
As long as I'm not your target.
You'd be surprised.
Violence solves--
No, no you don't.
Okay, close your eyes. And... ten!
I'm unleashing all of my artillery onto a fleet of Morganas. How soothing...
Nine!
Jenkins falls overboard and we're out of life rafts.
Eight!
Milk is distributed in bottles and the inventor of the carton is hung, drawn, and quartered.

Fields.MenuText: Are you even trying?
I don't think you're getting the point of this.
Maybe this is hopeless after all.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll try, I'll try!
Seven!
Spending time with Vimiera... I guess...
Good. Six!
Shopping for new clothes.
Five!
*ALARM*
Morgana alarms. Oops! That one was a slip of the tongue, Captain!
I'll allow it! Now, come on! We have work to do!
@BATTLE
Don't make me start over!
Pessimism is counterproductive!
Shall we continue?
Yes, Captain.
Four!
Roast lamb on the barbie on a hot summer's day...
Three!
A great game of chess.
Two!
Being welcomed home after a long day by the crew.
One!
Spending time with the-- RAHHH! What have you got me saying?!

Fields.MenuText: We were so close.
Looks like it was too good to be true.
Well, there goes my counting idea.

Fields.DialogueText: I think I got a little carried away towards the end there, but I could feel the anger melting away as I reminisced on the things I care about.
*ALARM*
I hope I haven't inadvertently transformed you into a pacifist. We'll be sitting ducks without your presence!
HA! It'll take more than that to uproot my whole personality, Captain! Still, I feel as though the anger is more under my control now. No more random lash-outs.
That's amazing, Vendetta!
Thank you, Captain. For always believing in me.
@BATTLE
No, Captain. It helped a lot.
We're closer than we've ever been!
What makes you say that?
Captain, you're a formal naval officer right?
The last time I checked...
I was wondering if you could assist me in learning to *ahem* talk all proper like you fancy suit-types.
Are you having trouble being understood?
Not exactly, but I'd like to be able to talk like that on certain occasions.

Fields.MenuText: I think you sound fine as is.
The crew understand you... well enough.
Will you ever need this? You're not attending any cotillions, are you?

Fields.DialogueText: Still! Can you help me?
*ALARM*
As payback for helping me defeat these Morganas? Sure!
@BATTLE
Don't be so evasive, Captain. I understand that dialect.
Not in the foreseeable future, but a couple of American girls are great ones for those...
"The Morgana in Tijuana is intoxicated by the fauna." Repeat!
"The Morgana in Tij-Tiju..." THIS IS HOPELESS!

Fields.MenuText: Did you not learn this kind of stuff at... I don't know... Belle school?

Fields.DialogueText: If you're talking about my training, then all I learned was how to sink a fleet, not how to ask them to brunch!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we could try a different phrase.

Fields.DialogueText: I love tongue twisters!

Fields.MenuText: It's not like you to be so defeatist.

Fields.DialogueText: I know... I need to snap out of it!
I guess we can try one more time. Now, from the top--
*ALARM*
Morganas! If they dock, they're going to ruin the dock's fauna!
While we're docked, let's work more on your pronunciation.
What was that?
Are you deaf, Captain?! I said the Morganas are going to ruin the fauna!
Once more.
The Morgana! The Fauna!
And what's a city in Mexico that begins with a "T"?
I don't know! Tijuana!?
By Jove, I think she's got it! Now, show these Morganas what a well-spoken lady can do!
I'm not sure what you mean, Captain, but you don't have to tell me twice!
@BATTLE
Captain, do you have a second?
Sure, what's on your mind?
I just wanted to thank you.

Fields.MenuText: I'll always be there for you.
I promise I'll never leave you.

Fields.DialogueText: Look, I know I punished Jenkins for falling asleep on the deck, but that was done out of obligation rather than as a favour to you.
It isn't that. You know, after London sent me down under, I thought I wouldn't be able to trust again. I tried to stay harsh and carefree so as to avoid getting close to people.
Vendetta...
Anyway, you know I'm not some kind of cuddly toy, so that's all you're getting out of me by way of appreciation!
*ALARM*
Blast these Morganas! Ruining such a precious moment. Let's deal with them quickly!
@BATTLE
I know you've hard a hard life, Vendetta. But that doesn't mean you have to let that define you. I know there's a caramelized centre to this tough exterior.
Captain... Don't say such things... you'll put thoughts in my head.
What I mean to say is...
HA! Thanks, Captain! I'll hold you to that!
H-Ha...! You charmer, you. I'll hold you to that.
